disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Catholic Church when experiencing frustration with individuals within?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when disagreeing with a fellow parishioner's perspective?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when my frustration with certain individuals within it led me to harbor discordant thoughts and feelings?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: on obligatory days , such as Ash Wednesday
disobedience.question: Did I intentionally fail to abstain from food on obligatory days, such as Ash Wednesday?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

over your fertility and disregarding trust in His plan for your life
in His plan for your life

disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately altering one's fertility represents an act of defiance against God and implies we know better than divine wisdom, placing our desires for control above trust in God's plan for our lives.

disobedience.question: Did I speak disrespectfully about the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: in activities on Sundays that could have been avoided
disobedience.question: Did I engage in activities on Sundays that could have been avoided, thus disrespecting the Lord's day of rest?
disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: from staying away from Sacraments or Mass by your words
condoning.question: Did you condone other Catholics from staying away from Sacraments or Mass by your words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from receiving Sacraments or attending Mass
condoning.question: Did I advise fellow Catholics, through my words, to refrain from receiving Sacraments or attending Mass?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I use my words to discourage other Catholics from participating in the sacraments, especially when they were struggling or in need of spiritual guidance?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I permit my child to persist in confusion by avoiding an uncomfortable conversation?

extracted_data_phrases: in I believe what is right

condoning.description: Prioritizing human approval over standing firm in God's truth demonstrates both moral cowardice and places human opinion above divine authority.

condoning.question: Did you condone a funeral where a loved one's remains were not properly buried, contrary to Church teaching?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

uncharity.question: Did I allow my own desires and interests to influence how I made decisions, especially when they conflicted with the needs of others?

extracted_data_phrases: through my thoughts , words , or actions that disregard their inherent dignity as children of God

uncharity.description: Treating others with disrespect denies their inherent dignity as beings created in God's image and violates Christ's command to love one another as He has loved us.

uncharity.question: Did I fail to treat others with patience and understanding?

greed.question: Have I made accumulating wealth, possessions, and material comforts a primary driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: such as material goods , money , and wealth ,
greed.question: Have I made accumulating possessions, such as material goods, money, and wealth, a driving force in my life that distracts me from trusting God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps through harsh words , unjust treatment , or discriminatory behavior
oppression.question: Did you in any way mistreat others, perhaps through harsh words, unjust treatment, or discriminatory behavior?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence, even when experiencing personal success or achievements?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, attributing them to my own efforts rather than acknowledging God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

autonomy.question: Have I taken for granted the blessings in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in my conversations, using language that was hurtful or disrespectful to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to meals or snacks at home
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to meals or snacks at home or when socializing with family and friends?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what is reasonable, thereby neglecting my spiritual and physical well-being?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
into excessive cravings or desires for sweets , treats , or other indulgences that compromised my spiritual well - being and health goals
for sweets , treats , or other indulgences that compromised my spiritual well - being and health goals
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable? Specifically, did I give into excessive cravings or desires for sweets, treats, or other indulgences that compromised my spiritual well-being and health goals?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing others ' private affairs or discussing their faults
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs or discussing their faults, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: through conversations with friends from church or community groups
with friends from church or community groups
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true, through conversations with friends from church or community groups?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I derived pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: on a Sunday , which is a holy day of rest
impiety.question: Did you engage in work on a Sunday, which is a holy day of rest?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: with friends , family members , or community group participants
anger.question: Have I nursed anger rather than seeking reconciliation when disagreeing with friends, family members, or community group participants?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeking reconciliation and peace in our interactions
anger.question: Have I nursed anger within my family relationships, rather than seeking reconciliation and peace in our interactions?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
